I sent my phone in expecting my amount for "Flawless" condition. Instead, they offered me the price for "faulty" condition, dropping from $693 to $197, because of some spots on the camera. I politely asked for my phone to be sent back to me when they suddenly upped my offer to $325. Why not offer this right away? My phone is in obviously perfect condition besides minor spots that only show during portrait mode. Not to mention, $325 is still below their price point for "Fair" condition even though, according to their site, this means the phone "shows heavy signs of use such as deep or excessive scratches, dings, dents, scuffs or abrasions but no cracks." My phone is in excellent condition! They are lowballing me and are not eager to give me my device back. I'm writing this so others can be aware.

Absolutely AWFUL. I sent them my device that was in excellent condition, no screen cracks, no damage, battery working perfectly. They sent me an email saying that my device had multiple cracks and that the battery was faulty. I took before pictures of my phone right before I sent it off and it was PERFECT. Honestly this site is a scam and very untrustworthy. Will be writing an email to get my device back.

Terrible experience. My iPhone was in impeccable condition - I had a case and screen protector on it 100% of the time. They evaluated it in fair condition and offered me half of the originally quoted price. I am having it sent back to me and will sell it to a more honest company. A serious waste of time. Update - now I have Trustpilot demanding I provide my full name, email address, reference number, and telephone number to GadgetGone or my review will be deleted. Why would I want GadgetGone harassing me? I have full email documentation of my experience with them. In fact, I had GadgetGone return my iPhone and sent it off to another company who paid me a very fair price for it. Don't trust a review website that deletes negative reviews!!!

Review.Contenu: I sent a phone box and accessories charger and ear set never used. They gave me a quote of $130. Then emailed the adjusted price at $25. I asked to have my stuff returned. They returned the phone only and kept my box and accessories. Not honest business that is steeling.

Ok, Ive seen so many positive reviews about gadgetgone. Unfortunately my review can not be one of them!  After waiting many days for a quote, I finally received an email stating that my phone is not in the condition I claimed it was in.  They said my phone is not unlocked.  And it actually is, I unlocked it before sending it to them for sure.  Then they claim the condition is nowhere near brand new, more like fair.  Preposterous! No cracks, scratches, no water damage.  It looks brand new like it is right out the box!   They also claim that internally, it doesnt meet "brand new" standards.  I can't imagine what a used phone must have to be like for them to pay decently. Realistically the only thing we have to wipe clean a phone is the factory reset.  Simply put there are too many made up issues on my used phone.  And then, the kicker...my quote was $9!  Ha! I paid $199 for it last 10 months ago. Sorry but from my experience, the long wait and  inaccurate evalution, I can say this company is a bit unrealistic for me, a time waster.

I mailed an iPhone SE (2020), 128GB, unlocked to GadgetGone to sell it to them. Took photos of front and back of the phone. Packed it in the original box with all the instructions and the charging cable, packed in a ton of bubble wrap. The phone was in like new condition, having never been taken outside the house and only used as a hotspot, with zero scratches on either the front or back. The first email from GadgetGone claimed that the phone was in "fair" condition with "Heavy Scratching” and offered $52, well below the $167 listed on their website . I responded to send the phone back to me. They revised their offer to $67 and after I declined, then to $92. I again declined and told them to send the phone back to me. There is simply no way that this phone is in any condition less than “like new”.I just received the returned phone, but just the phone. None of the original packaging or charging cable were returned to me. The instructions on their website say to "Gather any accessories that are necessary to the function of your device and include them in the package. Some examples would be *watch bands*, *power cables* for gaming consoles, etc." Basically they stole these items from me and it makes it harder for me to sell the phone to another buyer without those items.

Review.Titre: Elected to have item returned and they kept all the accessories.
Review.Contenu: Claimed heavy scratching on a phone I was trading in and sent pictures, which clearly showed the screen protector still on it which was scratched, not the screen itself.   Tried to provide that information and got a condescending reply.   After several back-and-forths decided to have my item returned, at which point they replied it was shipped back with a screenshot of some portion their website saying my original iPhone box and accessories would not be returned.  Didn't even think twice about that until I recieved my phone back today, in an envelope, no box no charger.   They basically bury that little gem somewhere deep in the FAQs, don't tell you ahead of time then paste that in the "we've shipped your item back" email to cover themselves legally maybe.   Shifty company, not forthcoming, and will steal all your accessories and original packaging if you opt for the "If you aren't happy with the new amount you've been offered, you can elect to have your device shipped back to you. We'll even cover the return shipping cost.".As a follow up to the reply, just because you have that information somewhere on the website doesn't make it forthcoming.  It is not noted anywhere during the quote/order process that these items will be discarded.   No one is reading the entire website before sending you the items.  As far as the condition, and the correspondence, none of the "scratches" that were noted/photographed by your team were actually there when I received the device back, so those were either on the screen protector as I noted in my emails to customer service, or not pictures of my device at all.  As soon as I received the device back, I immediately sent it to another service like yours and received no mention of scratches or damage of any kind and received full price for my trade, which to be honest was a higher price than you initially quoted even prior to trying to reduce it.  So I suppose all in all this interaction worked out in my favor.

Review.Titre: Shady business will damage your device to devalue it
Review.Contenu: These reviews do not at all match my experience with this fly-by-night business. They took nearly a week to acknowledge that my device had been delivered, which package tracking showed. They "discovered" defects that were totally false, including damage that they presumably did to the device, using them to justify a lowball offer. They do this knowing you have no leverage to dispute it, and the only thing you can do is have them ship it back to you. I went with this business, based on these possibly false reviews and their higher purchase offer, instead of trading the device to Samsung, and this was a mistake.

I've noticed my last few transactions had the same flow. They indicated that my devices had issues and offered me much less that the quote. I would ask for my devices to be returned to me.  They came back with a counter offer. So I sent my so called damaged devices to Apple for repair. They indicated that my phones were in good working order.  I then sent my devices to another buyback company.  They offered me full price for my devices. After having the same thing happen over and over again,  I believe this is GGone's business model.  I will never send them anything again.

There were no scratches but at that point they had me where they wanted me. Too many companies to sell phones to to deal with this one.

Would never use this place again or recommend to anyone. You get quoted one price and it changes. I sent in two phones and they say there’s a blemish that drastically reduces the phone value. Both phones they wanted to offer half of what I was originally quoted. Dishonest company!

"We will evaluate your device(s) within 2 business days after the delivery date."Nope, it takes two weeks or more. GadgetGone needs to clearly state this on their homepage. Below they claim it's now eight business days, but it's already been eight business days and they told me it could be another week or two more."I’m reaching out to let you know that due to staffing issues in conjunction with high trade in volume surrounding the March Apple Product Launch, we are unfortunately a bit behind on our normal 2 business day turnaround. We're currently at about an 8 business day turnaround."I wouldn't mind all this if they clearly stated it on their website, like in a bold update "NOTICE: Reviews are taking one or two weeks longer."

Didn't have a great experience with this company even though they try to make things right I still will not be choosing this company to do business with ever again. It is good to see that other customers had a great experience but I didn't I will be going to a company that I've been doing business with for now on the only reason why I went with them in the 1st place because they were offering more. I updated my review only because I feel that I was a little unfair but overall my experience with this company I'm still unhappy.
Undisclosed criteria (battery at 80% or less is a failed battery) and they opened the phone up, then sent photos saying phone back had been opened. Not by me! Offered my $4 for the phone.
Below market value offered, undisclosed criteria for grading, super long wait time for initial review, and despite being less than 2 hours away from them, my check took over a week to arrive.

Terrible business practices. After turning down two terrible offers for a phone that was in pristine condition they returned it without the original box in which I sent it. After contacting them about it the representative who replied indicated that this "policy" was in their "terms of use" to ensure safety for employees. Most individuals know that if you sell a phone privately, there is typically greater value if you have the original box but the box also contains critical info for a new owner such as the serial number, IMEI, etc. It is almost as if GadgetGone is setting you up to get less for your phone privately after trying to convince you that your phone is defective.

I sent Gadget Gone an iphone 5s and described it in good condition which it was. They gave me a $75 estimate for my phone. Once they received the iphone they revised their estimate to $12 because the battery was functioning at 50%. They said the iphone was broken because of the battery. The iphone 5s was released in 2013 and to expect the battery not to be worn down is unrealistic. I surely would have understood a reduction in the estimate to maybe $45 to $50 but to $12 was a bait and switch scenario. I had them send the phone back. Gazelle gave me a $55 estimate for the same iphone and when they received it they sent me a $55 check. Moral of the story, Gazelle = Good / Fair, Gadget Gone = BAD / Dishonest.

The phone was as new and I even included the original box and accessories which were not even asked for.Not, a good experience so don't trust the offer you get.

I sent 3 devices to Gadget Gone. They took 3 weeks to assess them, while trade-in values fell across the resale market, and then revised their offer down by 50% on every single dvice, for nonsensical reasons. For example, they lowered an offer on a 2019 macbook pro from $1350, to $480 due to a "Battery in poor condition". Battery replacements for macbook pros take 5 minutes and cost around $100, IF that, as apple replaces them for free quite often. This company baits customers by offering the highest prices for trade-ins on the market -- even higher than Apple is willing to pay - and then revises their offer down meaningfully once they have them in their possession. I'm sure the owner Patrick or one of his peons will respond to this review citing made-up hardware defects to justfiy this practice -- but just do yourself a favor and go with LITERALLY ANY other trade in service. If anyone has any questions about my review or wants to see receipts to demonstrate the truth of the interaction, please message me directly They also did an incrediblyh lazy job repacking the device I had them send back.Would give 0/5 if I could

Review.Titre: Downgrade attempt, wrong check received, all bad......
Review.Contenu: I had an iPhone that I received via an insurance claim and never used.  I got a decent quote from Gadget Gone, but was contacted and told that the phone was not in the condition I described and, of course, wanted to pay less for it.  I called them out on it and requested they return it, only then did they agree to pay the original estimate, which I accepted.  I had asked for a check by mail and received a check made out to someone else for about $10.00 instead of about $123.00.  I had to call back at which time they apologized.  Due to the inconvenience and delay, I asked them to PayPal the funds to me.  The "owner" contacted me and agreed to do so, but only if I paid the 3-4 dollars for PayPal vs mail.  I am amazed that a business wouldn't eat the few dollars for their mistake, especially after the attempted scam downgrade of the phone condition, but it's over.  It looks like others have had good luck, but please be wary of this business.  Kindest regards.

Review.Titre: Don't trade in your phone with Gadget Gone
Review.Contenu: I sent them a iPhone that was a year old and had been in a case with screen protectors the entire time. It was in perfect condition and I never had any problems with it. I almost didn't get the new iPhone because that phone was impeccable. I was very surprised to hear that upon their inspection, they said the main speaker did not work well and they were going to knock $300 off the price since it's "damaged". They stated they tested it using Voice Recorder. Well, I had often used voice recorder as well as speaker phone from across a room and knew it worked fine. They sent it back to me, and I promptly opened up Voice Recorder and it worked wonderfully. I don't know if it was a faulty test, or they have some impossible standard, but I have a feeling it was shady business practices. This experience with them was horrible, and I would not recommend them to anybody. I sent it to another phone trade in service once I got it back and it passed all their tests and I got the full amount paid for it. Trade in your phone somewhere else!

Dishonest. Gave high quote for iPhone trade in. They claim some issue with the SIM tray on otherwise spotless phone and they knocked the value down 40%.Not reputable. Do not recommend. Even Apple claims a much higher trade in valuation.—— Update based on their response. They originally sent an email stating 40% lower quote. They did NOT provide details other than “wrong SIM card tray”. Casey sent a photo zoomed in to show wear, except that absolutely no wear is visible in this photo. BTW, silver finish is the raw color of the aluminum. It is not a paint or anodized coating so I don’t know how you describe it as wearing off. Overall I’ve requested to have my phone returned. It is not worth arguing. If it hadn’t been for this Trustpilot review I doubt they would have provided any justification for their 40% lower quote.----Update: Received phone back.Their noted "wear" on the back is microscopic. Dishonest. It is so small that a high resolution iPhone photo closeup cannot show it. It is a barely colored small dot. No one would ever see any flaw there.More concerning, my flawless phone, when returned now has a bunch of light scratches on the screen that were NOT there before. This phone has always had a screen protector and screen was immaculate.Overall very disappointing. Reduced offer was dishonest at best.
Over 2 months and still haven’t received payment.

Review.Titre: I sent in 2 iPhone 7's that were in…
Review.Contenu: I sent in 2 iPhone 7's that were in good condition. Was quoted $71 each. Then I got the email saying the batteries on the phones did not charge above 80% of it's capacity. They offered $21 for each. While I accepted the offer because I didn't want the hassle I question the original offer as a legit offer since there isn't an Iphone 7 out there that would be able to charge above the 80% of capacity rate even if it set in a box the last 10 years. I consider this a deceptive practice. There was never a mention about a battery needing to be +80% charge capacity, (Both phones charged to 100% on the phone), for the offer to be "good".  If they would have included that info in their pitch  then I would not have sent to them as ALL batteries degrade over time. Also read some reviews after the fact that people have not accepted their offer and were offered more money once or even twice. They seem to have a policy of lowballing you hoping you take it and if not they sweeten the pot. Kind of scammy really. Seller be ware!!!

Review.Titre: Took too long then couldn’t get cash…
Review.Contenu: Took too long then couldn’t get cash because I don’t have a PayPal account. Will not use again

Review.Titre: I sent them a perfectly good phone
Review.Contenu: I sent them a perfectly good phone.  Excellent condition.   The original offered $440 for the phone.  3 weeks later I got an email that the phone was defective, had problems and dropped the offer to $180.  I don't have time to deal with it.  If you're going to send a phone bring it to an Authorized Verizon Dealer or someone that can certify that the phone is in perfect working order.  This way if they claim the phone is defective you have proof that the phone was in working perfect order when you sent it in.

I sent my phone in thinking I was getting $600 for it. But because of two light scratches on the screen, they offered me $369. For an unlocked iPhone in great condition other than those two tiny scratches that did nothing to detract from the picture quality of the screen. If I could give anybody a piece of advice: sell your stuff anywhere BUT gadgetgone.

Review.Titre: not what I expected, at all
Review.Contenu: I submitted a Phone that was in flawless condition. It had a case and a screen protector on it for its entire life. But somehow, miraculously when they inspected it, there were scratches all over the place. I also was told that I would get a 20% bump on my gift card payout. But when you go to get that payout, there is no bump only very few choices offer 20%. This was not made clear and was certainly deceptive. So my phone was valued for a much lower amount than I believe it was really worth, and I didn’t get the increased payout on the gift card choice

Not transparent.  Gave a quote, then claimed that I misrepresented the condition.Better to take to Staples for a recycling credit.Update: CS reached out to me to explain, and did honor the original quote due to the response I received.I added a star for this resolution.The iPad wouldn’t power on, so I said it was faulty, and they offered $10; when they received it, they said the battery was bad which is different than faulty, and not worth anything.  I took offense when they said it was misrepresented.

When I filled out the initial assessment of my phone, per the companie’s instructions, they quoted me three times the amount of money that I actually got for my phone. They claimed that the phone’s battery was not at full power. Well, if it was at full power, I wouldn’t be trading it in for a new phone now would I? Service is very misleading.

Review.Titre: Helpful customer service, unfortunate loss in the facility…
Review.Contenu: Kiara was super helpful throughout the entire process, however the facility lost my charger and claimed I didn't put it in the shipping box, and they also tried to give me about $200 less and said there was scratches on the screen even though there weren't. I took pictures of everything before I sent it in including the screen. Loved Kiara’s customer service though.

Review.Titre: BEWARE OF THE BAIT AND SWITCH TACTICS
Review.Contenu: I’d be very wary of using GadgetGone, or recommending them, even though their quotes are better than most. Something seems very suspect with how they’re doing business. I documented my device, which had no scratches or scuffs on it, before sending to them. It took a couple of weeks but when I heard back they told me they were downgrading my quote due to “scratching.” I said I didn’t see any scratching when I sent it in and asked for proof. The images they sent back were of a phone totally scuffed and scratched that I struggled to believe it was mine (still up for debate!), so much so I sent the documentation I took right before I sent the device to them—which looked flawless and had no scuffs or scratches—but that went ignored. And this is where they have you cornered. After complaining about the outcome, they offered to send it back to me “free of charge,” which was truly hilarious because the phone looked positively trashed at this point. Plus, logically it just seems like the shipment back to me would be the cost of restoring their initial quote and would be a win for all parties. Alas, that solution didn’t occur to them. I had to eat the lesser quote, which I can only assume is exactly what they wanted. Anyway, I’m your cautionary tale, so do with it what you will. But just know you were warned.

Review.Titre: They offered me $85 for my 9 year old…
Review.Contenu: They offered me $85 for my 9 year old PS4, but when I shipped it to them they changed it to $50 because of "heavy/deep scratches" (which were actually barely visible light scuffs on the top due to it, you know, being 9 years old). When I declined their other lowball re-offer of $65, they shipped it back without the power cable, though they did respond quickly that they will ship a replacement out for free (just annoying).

Review.Titre: You know one of those life experiences…
Review.Contenu: You know one of those life experiences where you say I'll never do that again! This is one of those, typical corporation that has multiple fronts that has more work than the employees can handle. It took 10 business days to get my payout from delivery, and it was a burden to get that. I checked back at 9 business days and and they offered me way less that what I was expecting, I was mad, I said send my phone back then. Then they finally came back on the 10 day and offered the correct amount. I choose the gift card option because it mentioned Amazon and you may be able to get a bonus, there is no bonus for Amazon. I choose this because I figured it would be easy, nope not easy. At this point I was just grateful to get my payment but, it was upsetting enough for me to write this review, this company is not it.

Review.Titre: Had I not needed the money so badly
Review.Contenu: Had I not needed the money so badly, I would have not sold my phone for 68$. I know it was a gift, and had never been out of the box except to look at it. And it was a Verizon phone as that is all we have in our entire area of the Upper Peninsula of Michigan. 300 miles in any direction is all Verizon, not else exists here. And it had a brand new charger cord, and adapter, that were purchased with it too. Plus, I never got a refund for the case and glass covers either. So even two is higher than I should have given in my opinion.

Review.Titre: Be sure to take photos of your phone before sending to GadgetGone
Review.Contenu: I sent GadgetGone a rarely used and nearly new iPhone (my retired husband using it to make the occasional phone call and little else) We bought the phone new and installed in an extra-sturdy case from day one; even sending the phone to Gadget Gone in this never-removed case. Yet when Gadget Gone wrote back they downgraded the original flawless rating I'd given it, because of supposed scratches on the back. I asked to see photos and was sent images of a scratched phone that could NOT have been the phone we sent (how does a phone get scratches when it's never been out of its case?). Their response time answering my questioning emails was very slow, too. From sending off the phone to receipt of the reduced check, it took nearly 3 weeks.

Review.Titre: I sent an iPhone and iPad terrible
Review.Contenu: I sent an iPhone and iPad. They were in great condition. I knew the iPhone battery was not to notch. But the iPad had never been outside the cover. When they examined it they said the screen was loose???? I t old them to send them back to me then they offered a ridiculous price if $65 for both but to prevent a hassle I took it. Then when the money arrived in my PayPal account it was only $58 and change. I won’t ever use them again. I would have done better on Facebook or marketplace.

Review.Titre: My phone was in better condition and…
Review.Contenu: My phone was in better condition and worth more $ than the tech Skye approved it for. At that point I was already waiting 10 days for payment so I took the low ball offer.
my money but it was $35 less than I thought I would receive. You do send me a photo that my battery wasn’t up to par. Legitimate company but hoped for a better deal.

I shopped around for the best price and chose this site because they offered the highest price. I mailed it to them as instructed and it took nearly 2 weeks for them to “assess” my phone. The phone was case-kept and in great condition. They claimed it had “deep scratches” and offered $60 less than quoted. It’s a classic bait and switch. This is the 4th time I have used a websites to sell my phone and never had any issues with others. Use someone else.

Review.Titre: Phones we in perfect condition and…
Review.Contenu: Phones we in perfect condition and quoted a certain amt.  Once they got them the amt dropped in half and only option was a gift card
Advertised a $170 payout for my old phone that had a small crack(not on the screen). I sent it in and they paid a whopping $29 for it.

Review.Titre: The process was quick and seamless
Review.Contenu: The process was quick and seamless. However, I was quoted at $280 for a phone that was kept in case for 2.5 years. Did not see any damage with the phone. When they received the phone the phone they told me there was more damage than expected and gave me a low ball offer at $190. I can't speak to how often this occurs, but their process is definitely not optimized to prevent this from happening.

I was excited to use Gadget Gone as they had the most competitive price of the sites I checked. However my experience was less than satisfactory. Their website said I would receive an email with the shipping label. When I hadn't received the label by the next day I sent a request through their website and was finally sent a label. I was told it would take 2 days for inspection. In fact it took 2 weeks from the day it was delivered to them. Then I received notice that the condition wasn't as good as I had claimed. I sent a mint device in the original box. Really disappointed with the experience.

Review.Titre: I had a very positive experience with…
Review.Contenu: I had a very positive experience with Gadget Gone. They responded very quickly to my submission, the price they gave me for my two telephones was very fair, sending them my phones was quick and easy, and my check arrived within a week. I will certainly use them again the next time I update my phone.

DO NOT USE THEM IF YOU NEED YOUR MONEY AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. 2 business days turns into 10. There is NO way to call the company on the phone, you can only communicate by email & it takes forever to hear back. It’s 2018 almost 2019 people why are we communicating by email & not by phone? The reason I gave 2 stars is because they do offer more than most companies. I WONT USE THIS COMPANY AGAIN.

Review.Titre: I would not recommend this company
Review.Contenu: I would not recommend this company. They are slow and have bad communication. They received my device on November 28, 2018 and it was supposed to be evaluated in 2 business days with a status update. Fast forward to today December 10, 2018. I have emailed them multiple times with no response.  At this point I just want my phone back or a check sent out with the quote I was given. In the future, I would not use this company again.

I mailed in my iPhone which was in mint condition, they claim that it wasn't and emailed me photos of what was supposedly my phone. I know for a fact it wasn't my iPhone in the photo. After waiting so long for them to get back to me and the back and forth emails I just told them to mail me the check. It was just too much I would rather sell it to another company, or someone thats looking for a mint phone. Don't waste your time if you know what your phone is really worth.

I was skeptical of using gadget zone and answered all the questions regarding my phones condition. My phone was damaged with cracks but functional. After i sent in the phone they emailed me stating that the screen was too damaged and that it was in the broken category and offered me a  way lower offer. My phone didn't categorize as broken in the list they have on their website. If I did use them again, i would keep in mind that their list is not always accurate after they receive and inspect the phone

Review.Titre: Negative experience and would not repeat
Review.Contenu: Has been a negative experience so far. Submitted my two phones and it was received Monday morning. They did not get back to me until Friday with both phones at a lower price than expected. Annoying that it took them so long instead of their couple of days promise, and lower offer. On one of the phones it was borderline insulting. Then they come back with my boss is so generous that he’s upping the offer by a measly amount and way below the original price. I say no thanks twice to one offer and agree to the offer, and still crickets. Nothing back from them. They should not be holding on to the phone for this long when it’s clear what I want. Either you agree or disagree and return the phones. Would not repeat.

Found a million things wrong with my perfectly good items to reduce the payout amount. I did get paid, so it's not a total scam, but they will not give you the stated amount. They will basically make up things that are wrong.

I found them through an article o cnet.com about reliable places to sell old phones.   I feel it is all a gimmick.  The initial offer was good so I boxed up my phone and sent it.  I got notification that they received it and were running behind because of covid.   When they responded again they said my phone wasn't that good and counter offered $50.00 lower.  I declined that offer and asked for my phone back.  Then I get another email saying the first person was wrong and a third offer.  I took the third offer because i just wanted to be done and took the paypal payment which deducted more.  I should have just dealt with sprint and been done with it.  I gave 2 stars because i did get paid but I would not recommend them

Review.Titre: Need to re-look at their rating levels for phone conditions.
Review.Contenu: They seem very organized and had great communication (texts and emails) along the way.  But my iphone was near perfect (always had a screen protector and solid case) and returned it in original box, etc.  I believed it was flawless, but they found a tiny scratch and demoted it to 'good' status for that.I won't be using this service again unless they take my advise and insert a rating between "Flawless" (perfect, not a single tiny scratch anywhere...so basically..new and who sells a brand new phone?) and "Good", which is where most phones land and quite a lot less of an offer.  Mine was near flawless or 'Excellent', but they don't have that rating.
Other than not giving proper evaluation. Always taking evaluations to good. Payment is kept on hold for a month. Bad experience.

Sent my iPhone 8+ in "good" condition and "unlocked". Their online offer was for $208. When they got the phone, they offered $96 on the basis that it was cracked and that it was still locked. In fairness, there was a crack but it was on the back that did not affect performance and therefore I reported it in "good" condition, which I believe it was, given 3 years of normal usage. Their next offer was for $110. Be that as it may, there was still the issue of it being "locked. I called my phone provider (again) and confirmed the phone was unlocked. I reported back to GagetGone, but again they insisted it was still locked. So I had them send it back to me, at which time I physically took it to my phone provider and physically took it to Best Buy and they both confirmed the phone is indeed unlocked. I will take this phone to a different buyer. I will say that their communication was efficient and they sent the phone back without hesitation.

The good news is, the submitting the phones online, the mailing the phones and receiving them was perfect.  I was checked on and informed of the process each step.  Other than that, I won’t be using this service again.  I had a large amount of phones and decided to give this place a test run.  Of the 9 phones I sent, one had been previously used and wasn’t new.  Plus it was older.  The other phones had only been taken out of their boxes, and turned on.  My quote was NO WHERE near what I was paid.  I was given reasons such as the microphone didn’t work on one, or the SIM card slot wasn’t working on another.  My $700 quote turned into around $150.  I had personally tested each and every phone before sending and packed them where as no damage would come.  There apparently were 3 that were activation locked and they sent those back.  I powered them up, reset them and was able to activate each one.  Just horribly disappointed in this company and will copy this review to other sites as to warn those who attempt to use it.  If you want to give a accurate quote, make sure and explain on your website before people send in their devices just what they are getting themselves into.

"unfortunately ran into a discrepancy. The screen is lifted off of the phone, most likely from an expanding batteryI" I sent in a perfectly operating and unmarked IPhone5S (kept in Otter box 4 years) for offered price of $75.  Four business days later I get an email saying I needed to go to ICloud to remove phone which I promptly did.  Next day I get another email saying: "Thank you for removing the iCloud account from the phone! We have processed your iPhone, but unfortunately ran into a discrepancy. The screen is lifted off of the phone, most likely from an expanding battery. This places the phone in our Damaged condition category which quotes at $35 for this model. I have attached some pictures for you to see."Quotes are exactly what was relayed.  When I asked for proof that the pictures were of the phone I sent in, Christina sent me pictures showing me the IMEID on the back of the phone, but not showing me the damage & the screen.Lesson Learned:  Take picture of your phone before sending it in.I don't understand how a battery can do that much damage to the phone screen in five days when it was packaged in its original box and sent via USPS according to Gadget Gone directions.I'm am convinced I got scammed by an individual (s) and the damage was done while in the facility. In this case, SELLER BEWARE!!!!!!

Review.Titre: BE CAREFUL HOW YOU DESCRIBE THE DEVICE
Review.Contenu: Gadget Gone was offering the highest amount for my phone when I researched who to sell it to. It is 3 or 4 years old but looks almost brand new so I claimed that it was in flawless condition since the categories are New-unopened, flawless, good, etc. They also ask if the phone is unlocked. When my phone is turned on it says T-Mobile but I bought it used online and it had been unlocked. I used it on Straight Talk and it actually ended up using an AT&T SIM card so I reported the phone as unlocked. I was told that, pending receiving the phone and inspecting it, my phone was worth $175. I printed off the prepaid label and sent the phone to them. After I mailed it I got a message telling me that instead of a few days on the turn around time they were actually running behind so it would be 7-8 days, which was ok with me. 10 days later I hadn't heard from them so I sent a message inquiring about the status. I got a message within 24 hours that after inspection my phone was found to only be worth $110 because it had a couple of blemishes and was not an unlocked phone. I asked for photos of these blemishes and explained to them that although the phone was originally a T-MOBILE phone, I had bought it unlocked and that they should have found the AT&T SIM card in it. The sent me photos of 2 scuffs that were so tiny it was laughable. I had to zoom in a ridiculous amount just to see them. Had they not circled them I wouldn't have been able to see them at all.They claimed these two "flaws" and the supposed unlocked status brought its worth down by $65 to $110. I again explained the unlocked phone situation and argued that the phone was at least worth the middle price of $145. They disagreed and offered to return my phone. I agreed that they needed to send it back. What they were looking for in a "flawless"  condition was a phone in which the plastic wrap had been removed from the box but it had never actually been taken out of said box. In their mind there is no difference between brand new and flawless so that price point is worthless. Had they checked with Straight Talk regarding the phone's number they would have found that the phone had been used with their company since I bought it. They took 10 days to tell me it wasn't unlocked. They could have taken 15 minutes to check on the phone's actual status. IF YOU DECIDE TO USE GADGET GONE TO SELL YOUR PHONE be advised that you will be wasting your time sending it to them if you have claimed it to be flawless and it has has ever been used. ALSO unless you bought your phone unlocked at the factory they will not agree that it is an unlocked phone. This company banks on you needing the money and overestimating what your phone is worth and once they receive it they use those assumptions to get you to agree to a decrease in what they originally offered. Fortunately I wasn't desperate for the money and I got my phone back and sold it to another company who stood by what they offered for my phone.
Took a while to review my phone and then provided quite a low counter offer. Probably won’t use them again.

Review.Titre: Pure communication on the site about…
Review.Contenu: Pure communication on the site about the status of my sale.

Review.Titre: Took almost 3 weeks to get a response…
Review.Contenu: Took almost 3 weeks to get a response and the sale wasn’t like the past 3 that I was compensation good amounts. This one was not the best, but everything changes, so we can’t expect the same outcome, so just make sure you go in as an informed seller so you won’t be disappointed like I was.

Review.Titre: Took weeks to get the evaluation done…
Review.Contenu: Took weeks to get the evaluation done and the money sent. Would have liked an update. Sent in a phone with quite a few scratches but all minor/light. Should have definitely fallen under “moderate scratches” but they decided to put it under “deep/excessive” which turns it from good condition to fair. they decreased my value from $800 to $600. Pretty steep. Needed the phone gone so I did it and they did respond fast after that, but still won’t be using this service again. Would not do it for anything that isn’t perfectly flawless otherwise get ready to have your refund reduced. They did offer to send it back free of charge however so theres that, but seems like an inconsistent system they have based on the other reviews I’ve read.

Featured on the website was the lure of a "20% bonus" if you went with a gift card with the Amazon logo prominently displayed.  It turns out that there are only a handful of gift cards with the 20% bonus and Amazon was not one of them.  Don't make the same mistake I did and just go with the cash payout.  On the plus side they will pay you what they say and are very prompt with customer service.
The price given is fair,  the payment is too long. I hope instruction to redeem morel clear since I am pretty new in this process!  Thank you,

Review.Titre: Gadget Gone bait-and-switch - reduced offer price to rip me off
Review.Contenu: I had a near perfect iPhone8, always in a case and lightly used. Gadget Gone tried to reduce the offer price by $20 for a few extremely minor light hairline scuff mark on the bottom back edge of the phone. Seriously it was probably manufactured that way. I’m sure they will sell it as “flawless”. I don’t trust to sell anything to them again. I’m giving a generous 3stars b/c they I received payment.

I sent my phone to gadgetgone after receiving their offer of $209 for flawless condition. My phone does not have a single scratch or abrasion on it because it was in an OtterBox.. and only used for 2 weeks before my father passed. It set in a drawer until I could get with Apple to clear the ID. Michael with gadgetgone just sent a quote of $109 claiming fair condition due to heavy scratches. Needless to say.. I've rejected the offer and requested my phone be returned. Again.  Never Ever Trust Your Devices With This Company.Update: After declining the offer of $109 was was sent an updated quote of $140 which I declined as well. I then counter offered a quote of $175 (which was the quote for "good condition". This offer was accepted by gadgetgone and payment was sent to my Papal account within an hour. I'll change experience rating from 1 STAR to 3 STARS.

Review.Titre: My iphone was in excellent shape
Review.Contenu: My iphone was in excellent shape. The battery was at 77%. They offered me $116 on the website. Then a few days later the offer went down to $35 because the battery was low. I call that BAIT AND SWITCH. When I protested, they upped the offer to $55. I opted to just stop the insanity and take the VISA card and be done. I will not deal with GadgetGone again.

Review.Titre: Just say it’s “Fair” save yourself some time
Review.Contenu: Might as well say you will never get the best price because we will find a dot or scratch no one else can spot with a microscope.

Review.Titre: There should be a rating between good…
Review.Contenu: There should be a rating between good and flawless. I sent in an iPad that was in excellent condition, one or two minor scratches on the back. I could only get a good rating. Who looks at the back when it is usually in a case?

Review.Titre: My I phone was In excellent shape no…
Review.Contenu: My I phone was In excellent shape no scratches, no marks, etc. According to their chart it said I should get $143.  I was excited about that so I sent my phone in. This is the reply I gotWe’ve tested your order and have the test results listed below. If you have any questions about your order, just click “reply” to this email and I will be happy to help!Device 1: iPhone 8+ - 128GB - ATT - Faulty ConditionPrice: $40DetailsPoor Battery: The battery health (the percentage the battery is able to charge as compared to its original battery life) is lower than 80% and/or indicates it needs servicingWhen I questioned them they said my phone even though in perfect condition fell into the faulty category now. They said they don’t fix any phones that they get.  I find this hard to believe! Also what phone if you are trading it in is still going to have a battery that is like new.  I know they will put s new battery in it and sell it for much more!  When I balked at the price they ended up giving me $57.  I should have just sold it out right!  What a scam!  The only good thing I can say is that they answered emails.
Service was good but I feel amount paid for.phone should have Bern higher

Review.Titre: The overall process is way too long
Review.Contenu: The overall process is way too long. It takes 3 weeks to get paid from the time you ship your phone.

Review.Titre: I believe my cell phone was worth more…
Review.Contenu: I believe my cell phone was worth more than I received,

Review.Titre: They will lowball you but quick turnaround
Review.Contenu: They ended up giving me less than quoted because of an extremely tiny nick on the back that they literally needed a microscope to take a picture of it. If I didn't need the money so quick I would have sold it myself. They also initially said that my phone was locked to T-Mobile. I then informed them that it was unlocked and to check again. They eventually did say that it was unlocked but still wouldn't go back to the original quoted price.

Review.Titre: Easy Process But Don’t Trust the Quote
Review.Contenu: The process was very easy and communication regular and consistent. My complaint is that they changed the offer after the fact. I classified my Apple Watch as “broken” when I requested a quote, and when they evaluated my device on receipt, they reduced the offer by half because the device was “broken”.

The process went very smoothly and timely and the money was received within a day of accepting the offer. However, I sent an iPhone that was in flawless condition but they evaluated it as in good condition resulting in a reduction in offer by $15. They give you the option to decline the offer and return the phone but after going through the trouble it wasn’t worth it. Not cool and annoying that they can’t deal honestly.

Offered me $220 for used iPhones. After evaluation changed offer to $82. When I complained they then admitted their evaluation had been “harsh” and then raised their offer to $107. High initial offer, but then nitpick your phone to get away with lowball offer to pay.

Since I left the review below, I heard back from the company. Am told that the reason for the delay is that they had a number of employees out sick. I’ll take them at their word and you should disregard the following: They received my iPhone a week ago and, despite the claim that they will respond in two business days, I’ve gotten no follow up. No response to email. The ‘Check Offer Status’ function on their FAQ page doesn’t work. Shady.

Review.Titre: Good company. Just a little frustrated...
Review.Contenu: If you ever touched your phone don’t sell it as “mint” they will find something wrong with it that only they would find, and give you less money. Otherwise it is a good company that will pay you. For the most part they are fair. I don’t suggest having a check mailed. It took one check of a larger amount over two weeks to get to me.
Mixed emotions. They did pay full amount as promised but sent a low quote that was associated with another account which caused a bit of an issue. I’d use again after all said and done.
Received an estimate of about 27 after describing a crack along the corner of the screen. However, after I had sent it in, I was offered $19 instead.

I sent in an iPhone 6S - IN PERFECT WORKING CONDITION - for a 'promised' payment of $155. They claim that they 'evaluate' the phones within 2 days of receipt, yet mine was delivered to them on August 27th, and was not evaluated until today, September 4th. They then claimed that the vibrate button doesn't work (it did when I sent it to them) and that the battery needs replaced, dropping their offer to $46. What a scam.Update: Someone else contacted me after I complained (and left this review) and said that after some finagling, my vibrate button DID in fact work, and that while my battery was ‘below standard average,’ it was only slightly so, and offered me the original price of $155. I accepted and received the check, a day late. This still seems very suspect and shady, which is why I’m only giving 3 stars. I wouldn’t do business with them again.

Review.Titre: Slow but finally got it done
Review.Contenu: So far, in the 2 weeks I've been dealing with GadgetGone, no one's ever bothered to answer the phone or return a voicemail, which is not a good start. Gazelle answers the phone because Gazelle's a legitimate outfit. GadgetGone does return email within a couple of days. Thank you, GadgetGone, for deigning to answer my email about the item I paid more than a thousand dollars for. Prospective customers whose property is in GadgetGone's possession aren't worth the effort to answer phone calls, much less call back. GadgetGone gave me a set of dates, then, after it got my item, pushed the dates back by 2 weeks as Thanksgiving approached. Apparently, Thanksgiving was a complete surprise to GadgetGone. If I didn't know better, I'd say it was a bait and switch: "Send us your item and we'll pay you on [date]," became "Send us your item and we'll pay you on [date + 2 weeks]."I'll revise as the process progresses and concludes.Update:GadgetGone paid as promised. The process took 3 weeks, which was more than twice as long as GadgetGone said.

Review.Titre: I recently sent my old I-Phone 6s into…
Review.Contenu: I recently sent my old I-Phone 6s into these guys to sell it after upgrading to an I-Phone 11. My 6s was in perfect working order and in excellent cosmetic shape. No cracks, scratches, dents, nothing broken and software was working just fine. My assessment of my phone should have brought their highest rating and the  most money ($50) which they offered for a phone like mine.  After their "technicians" inspected it, they came back with a ridiculous statement that there was a "white spot" and they were only going to offer me $9! I found this really offensive and told them to send it back to me.  I then was told their decision would be re-evaluated, ,and after that they upped their offer to $30, which I accepted.  I think they try to pull this with everyone who tries to sell electronics to them. I do believe they are not unique ini this practice, and I understand they  tried to get me old phone for as little as possible, but nonetheless it did leave a sour taste in my mouth. My advice to anyone using this or any other service like it to stick to your guns if your electronics only fault is being old and NOT damaged.  I got my check fairly quickly and am "ok" with my interaction with this company.

It is what it is. if your unit isn't sealed in the box. You'll likely not agree or enjoy the experience. The web site interface and quotes are there to entice you to send them your phone. Promising super fast turn-around, full resale value and immediate payment. Understand the business. On the backend they must pay as little as possible, as slowly as possible and maximize their profits. Be prepared for the value to be less if the unit has been used. Be prepared to wait longer than promised. If you get on their radar by constantly e-mailing, they'll eventually get back to you when your hot to put out the fire. Have low expectations and dont need anything super fast and ehh, you'll get about the same price in the same amount of time as CL or a private sale. For me, it was less than Verizon  offered on a trade in. So, I lost $300. Your likely not going to get a killer deal and instant cash. They will have answers for it all, Covid, staffing, some minor blemish they found under neon lights or something. None of which is posted on the web site. The web site is for you to take their desired action. Send it in.  Your not going to kill it here with your used device. Its just a mediocre option to get rid of it if you cant trade it in. Thats my experience. Just whatever. took well over a month and finally got paid after several e-mails. Much less than trade in value. I tried it, now I'm over it. Just trade it in if it qualifies is my advice.
They are okay.

Our family of 5 recently moved from Ohio to North Carolina, and specifically, to a region where Sprint coverage was non-existent. This necessitated us moving to another carrier, and we were unable to bring our phones as they were not compatible. I’m a drug counselor, which is a highly fulfilling calling, but no one gets rich helping heroin addicts and their families walk through the hell that is addiction. I needed to sell our old phones quickly, and for as much as possible to help cover the price of our new devices and the start-up costs of the new plan. We sold four (4) iPhone SE (A1723) models, 9 months old to gadgetgone.com. I extensively researched this company, along with others. Read Trustpilot reviews and felt confident moving forward based on many positive reviews. My experience definitely did NOT match the substantial positive feedback that you see here. Hopefully my experience was an anomaly and yours, should you choose to use this vendor, will be positive and leave you feeling like a valued customer.I requested a quote online for my four devices. I received a quote for $340 total for 4 phones in flawless condition. My phones were purchased outright, brand new the first week of December 2017. Upon arrival, all four were immediately placed into their brand new Spigen cases. They lived there for the 9 months of our ownership. When I prepped the devices for sending to gadgetgone, I inspected them closely. They were each in incredible condition. I followed USPS tracking and saw that the phones were received by gadgetgone on Monday 8/27 at 1:33pm. Based on the gadgetgone website promise of communication regarding their receipt of my phones and a quote within 2 days of receiving them, I expected a quote by the end of the day Wednesday. I did not receive communication from gadgetgone of any kind informing me that they had received the phones. I did not receive a quote or communication on Wednesday 8/29 or Thurday 8/30. On Friday I received the following:Hi Jeffrey,Thank you for your patience while we inspected your devices. They work perfectly but unfortunately, they do not meet our mint condition criteria of being flawless. I have attached some pictures of the blemishes for you. Our quote for these iPhones would be $20 less than mint each, so you would receive a total of $260 for these iPhones rather than the originally quoted $340.Please let me know if you agree to this revised offer or if you need any additional information. Please remember that you are not obligated to accept our quote. We can arrange to ship your iPhone(s) back to you if you would prefer. Please let us know within the next 7 days. If we don’t hear from you within that time frame we’ll go ahead and send your check out for $260.Thank you!Mishelle, GadgetGone Customer SupportThis email was accompanied by 3 drastically magnified pictures under “jewelers” lighting of microscopic blemishes. You “may” be able to unbox a stock iPhone and photograph it without discovering these type blemishes. No phone, having been unboxed and placed into a protective case could exhibit less wear than my phones did. That said, I responded immediately that I understood that their underwriting would not qualify these phones as flawless, so, I was willing to take a lower amount for the phones – but not the drastic discount of nearly 25% to their original proposal. I asked them to consider discounting only $10 per phone. This email received no response. I did, however, receive this email;Hi Jeffrey!I also found during testing that three of the iPhones with the IMEI numbers, 359143077011547, 359222071167917, and 359144079081322 have an unpaid balance with Sprint/Boost Mobile. In order for these devices to be eligible for the revised offer, we would need these balances to be paid off. Please let me know when you get that done or if you have any questions. Thank you!Mishelle, GadgetGone Customer SupportKeep in mind, that these phones were purchased outright, and then used on a Boost Mobile prepaid account. It is impossible to carry a balance on this type account… I had communicated this clearly to Mishelle during the quote process. I also notified her that Boost had provided the account numbers and released all 4 phone numbers to the new carrier – something they would NEVER do if I had any type of outstanding balance. Days later, I received this email;Hi Jeffrey,I went ahead and re evaluated your devices and it looks like there is no unpaid balance due. I apologize for the error! Your revised quote for your devices would be $260. Please let me know how you would like to move forward or if you have any additional questions. Thank you!Mishelle, GadgetGone Customer SupportI emailed her the following;Michelle, Thanks for acknowledging the mistake. Could you also clarify if you have reviewed my counter offer sent previously (see our message thread), I'm attaching it here again for your convenience:Thanks for the note and for providing pictures of the condition issues. I understand your grading, and am willing to take a smaller amount - but a reduction of $20 per phone is too steep. I would accept a reduction of $10 per phone for a total settlement of $300. If that is acceptable to you, go ahead and process the transaction via echeck.Between the excellent condition of the phones, the delay in initial response and the error on past balance due, I am hoping you can meet me half way on the price. Let me know as soon as possible, thanks - J.P.She responded that they could not do this and remain competitive. As I had been without the phones for 13 days at this time, and desperately needed to cover the cost of the new devices and start-up costs of the new plan, I grudgingly accepted this offer. Mishelle let me know that the settlement check would be emailed by the end of that same business day – and it was.So, here are my thoughts: *Every interaction with Mishelle was polite – that’s always a plus. *I am convinced that, though they offer a “flawless” condition payout (as well as a “new” classification), there is likely no actual flawless condition that ever is paid out. If my phones didn’t qualify, I can’t imagine where the line between flawless and new is drawn?? *I absolutely feel played by the bait and switch. No question, gadgetgone’s initial bid was the highest that I found. However, the actual settlement, was actually lower than nearly all the other bids I received. Think about that… While I certainly was not forced to take the low bid, my circumstances – aggravated by gadgetgone’s delayed responses – placed me under a bit of duress. *The unpaid balance scenario, combined with the lack of response to my counter-offer, certainly felt like a set-up to paint the low counter-offer in a more attractive light.Gadgetgone is definitely not a scam site. They have way too many positive reviews to even think that. However, those positive reviews absolutely did not mirror my experience. They did not live up to their own claims of responsiveness, payout or integrity. I would choose to work with another vendor in the future based on my disappointing and costly experience.***Update after response from Gadgetgone***I really do appreciate that Patrick Haney, the Owner of gadgetgone, takes time to respond to less than stellar reviews on Trustpilot. While it’s true that most of his responses are ‘let me show you where you were wrong’ – it still deserves acknowledgment as he doesn’t have to take the time to respond. Since you find me on a day where I am at my wits end with companies that overpromise, under deliver and then qualify their apologies with excuses, I’ll engage.Ultimately Patrick, you acknowledge that, of my three issues, you failed on the first item, you failed on the second item, and I failed on the third item. Fair enough. You state in your response; “We strive to make sure every one of our customers have an exceptional experience.” I don’t buy it. Taking 20 seconds to send a form email stating that you indeed received my phones is not “striving”, it’s customer service at the base level. You didn’t even achieve base level customer service. Understanding that a Boost mobile phone is not a Sprint mobile phone is not “striving” it’s basic information that a layperson can discover – let alone a representative AND the owner of company that resells iPhones for a living. That my phones were Boost phones was clear from my initial contact with your company.You are correct, I went back and looked at the flawless condition description on the website, and my phones did not meet that. Based on this, I will revise my feedback rating to 3-stars and remove “I feel played” from the review title.(Leadership training tip: That’s what owning an error with integrity looks like.)

Review.Titre: Batteries are never going to pass your…
Review.Contenu: Batteries are never going to pass your inspection. Put on your website a battery testing tool as part of the quote process

They were communicative through the process, when I reached out. They took about 2 weeks to process though. And the link never updated to show package was delivered. They can be upfront in their timelines before the order is placed.Importantly the deal they gave was the best in Swappa.

The item was delivered but in my account, it showed nothing. I had to contact the company, only to find out that it was delivered. After that, they offered a lower price for what is a brand new item. I had to haggle to get the price increased.

Review.Titre: Easy submission of my phone for sale
Review.Contenu: Easy submission of my phone for sale. Received payout 20 days later. I was not impressed that they decreased the value with the claim that the device had light body damages — it had always been in a case, but it wasn’t enough of a difference to make me start over with a different vendor. Caveat emptor.
Communication was good, except it took longer than I thought to assess my device.

Review.Titre: All was good till you lowered my…
Review.Contenu: All was good till you lowered my original offered amount

Review.Titre: Efficient process to sell unwanted items
Review.Contenu: Process was very efficient and very easy to sell my old iphone 6 w/64 GB. Company communicates very well via text and email. Funds offered was much lower than anticioated as they noted "light scratches" on screen that apparently i wasn't able to see with nake eye and "light wear", thus received almost half of what was anticipated. Accepted offer, wasn't goning to haggle over it as it wouldn't have been worth the time. Gift card received of $13 was valid for merchant purchases.

A great experience and I would have given 5 stars except for them saying my phone had scratches.  Since it was always covered by an Otter case and screen savers, and I saw no scratches on it when I sent it.  That didn't feel right to me, but the price did not change that much so, I accepted the deal.  Otherwise, the process was clear, easy and quick and I had no difficulties getting the deposit into my account.

Review.Titre: Using Gadget Gone was simple to use
Review.Contenu: Using Gadget Gone was simple to use. I didn’t think that the price I received for my phone was good considering the big difference in rate. I also did not like the way you get your payment as I do not like providing my bank account information to any party online. I prefer either a prepaid Visa card or a check.

Review.Titre: I got a good price for my iPhone
Review.Contenu: I got a good price for my iPhone. The only problem I had was using the Tremendous gift card. Tremendous sent me a link to input my mailing address, which was required before I could receive the card. The online form wasn't working, though, and I was unable to type any text into the address field. I tried on different devices at different times, and finally sent a message. They did something on their end, and I was finally able to input my address so I could get the card. This was extremely annoying, and made me wonder whether I would ever get my money for the iPhone!

Review.Titre: Gadget Gone: The Best Way to Sell Your Used Electronics
Review.Contenu: If you're looking to sell your used electronics, Gadget Gone is the best way to go. They're a safe, reliable, and professional service that will give you the best possible price for your device.I recently sold my old iPhone to Gadget Gone, and I was so impressed with their service. The process was quick and easy, and I was offered a fair price for my phone. Even better, Gadget Gone was willing to go above and beyond by quoting me even higher after seeing my device.I would highly recommend Gadget Gone to anyone looking to sell their used electronics. They're a great company with a great service, and you won't be disappointed.

I was disappointed that the descriptions needed did not provide the question of how much battery life could be charged.  It showed fully charged prior to sending it. I understand that battery life degrades over time, but the drop in value promised was 60%.  So, be aware that the odds of them giving you as much as they initially said it was worth are very low. Other than that all went went.

Review.Titre: My overall experience with Gadget Gone…
Review.Contenu: My overall experience with Gadget Gone was positive.  Had a couple phones that wouldn't register up for GG for unknown or unexplained reason/s. These devices were active and working prior to sending them in. They were erased, upgraded and charged. If GG is going to offer $0.00 for such devices, I believe they should return them to the owner.

Price quoted was fair and above apples trade in value. However evaluations took longer than apples instant trade in. When using the tracker it said my order was not to be found which caused some panic but an email away took care of the issue. I had to nudge because it was over a week after it was received and I had not heard anything. Email responses were responded to promptly for the most part so I have to give you 5 stars on customer service.

Review.Titre: Final price was what was originally offered.
Review.Contenu: Received the original quoted price for my iPhone 12 Max.

I have now used Gadget Gone for the sale/trade of 2 phones that I could not easily sell on my own. They make it so easy! Their excellent customer service, direct positive communication, overall ease of use and amount granted for the trade is better than other sites. I trust this site, would use again and would highly recommend them to anyone.

Review.Titre: Very easy process to send in 2 iPhones
Review.Contenu: Very easy process to send in 2 iPhones. Communication was excellent. My only disappointment was that they gave me less for one of the phones than I was anticipating. One of the phones I sent in had very noticeable scratches on both the screen and device, while the other was in pristine condition. Nevertheless, I was told that BOTH had "noticeable light scratching" on the screens and devices and that I would be getting the same offer for both phones. It wasn't worth arguing with them over it, so I let it go. But in the future I think I may take my business elsewhere.
Gadget Gone has corrected the situation, I have received the funds they promised me.
Excellent process, although very slow. They had great communication, and everything went smooth.
Their service took about a week to process my (which is fine, I understand processing can take a bit), they paid quickly, and were very friendly.

Review.Titre: They want you to send them the phone…
Review.Contenu: This company is very professional and will reach out to you and try their best to give you a positive outcome for your devices. I would have given them a five however I did not because I would like for them to include battery health on the form before you send in your device. They leave out battery health. They need to put battery health on the form before you waste your time sending the phone in. So, once they see the battery health they can refuse your device.
The shipping process is quick. But the evaluation took more than a week and I was not notified how long it would take

Review.Titre: I would have given them five stars if…
Review.Contenu: First of all, they have the wrong name for my review.  I am not represented by the given name.  I am a private individual. I would have given them five stars if it wasn’t for them trying to give me less money when they examined the 2 iPhones SE2020. I had to complain and tell them they were like used car salesmen trying to give me less money so they can turn around and say my phones were pristine and sell for more. They finally agreed to pay the original price, which I received quickly after that.

Overall the experience was solid, the staff was communicative and funds were delivered promptly. My only feedback was the condition of the phone was deemed lesser than quoted based on their criteria. It would have been helpful to have pictures to accompany the criteria to help me better determine the quality and cost per device. I would definitely recommend the service if you're looking to sell your old device instead of it collecting dust in a drawer, like many of my phones have in the past:)

Review.Titre: I had a GREAT experience with…
Review.Contenu: I had a GREAT experience with GadgetGone.com! I sold them my old iPhone and they gave me an extremely fair price for it and it was very easy to do. It did take me a couple days to get paid, but that was due to my misunderstanding of what I was supposed to do. If I had read ALL the INSTRUCTIONS, I would have gotten paid sooner. I endorse these guys 100%! As a matter of fact, I am contacting them again to sell them my wifes phone and I am looking for a GIFT for my nephew so here I come gadgetgone.com!
Very helpful, I just don't give a full star because they reduced the price of the device a little even though it's brand new

Review.Titre: Was taken aback by initial offer on…
Review.Contenu: Was taken aback by initial offer on iPhone. You should mention that there could be an issue with the battery which will greatly impact the price.
Process was excellent. I was surprised that they re-traded the price due their claim of additional "wear" on the phone that I was not aware of when I shipped it.

Fast service. Little disappointed with review of my phone. I was told it had light scratches so the amount quoted was not what I received. I should have taken pictures of the phone (my bad) and I may have been able to argue the “said” scratches.

Review.Titre: I was given an initial quote for my…
Review.Contenu: I was given an initial quote for my phone. When they received it and inspected it they offered me less. I countered and it took them 5 days to get back to me. You feel kind of helpless since you don't have your phone and your have to wait on them. Ultimately they met me in the middle on the price and apologized for the delay.

Skye with customer service reversed what initially would have been a one star experience. After sending in my phone with a very promising quote, it took longer and the ultimate offer was reduced dramatically.  Skyes professionalism, explanation and resolution helped with a very favorable compromise. It wasn't all about money at any point - her polite and considerate emails handling both the time frame (they are deluged now with a new release) and value made this a very satisfying experience.
It was a good experience. Had to open a box to find out information on a unused phone and was docked money because of it.

Review.Titre: Gadget Gone is incredibly easy to use…
Review.Contenu: Gadget Gone is incredibly easy to use and is a fast turn around. The team is responsive. There is a choice of ways to be paid and I only wish there was still the option of receiving a check.

Review.Titre: I had a pretty good experience
Review.Contenu: I had a pretty good experience. My only real complaint is the time  it took to evaluate my devices.
Fairly easy process. Customer service was top notch. Smooth payment process. Would use again.
Great communication from Casey in customer service. Took longer than expected, and final offer was lower than first offer. Overall not a bad experience.
Good prices but it took a while to get my items evaluated. Also, I think my first time user bonus was forgotten.
Redeeming the points were difficult. A check would’ve been best. Did not want to give my bank account info

Things were pretty good, but it took longer than I expected.  They said they would get back to me to confirm with in two days from when they got it, but I had to email to check in.  Then it only took 2 more days ...
Other than the waiting period the transaction was perfect. I just wish you guys offer a expedited process like some other competitors.
I got money for my old phone!

Review.Titre: Just took a little longer to get…
Review.Contenu: Just took a little longer to get evaluated than I anticipated.
Gadget Gone kept communications by email and I never had to guess what was happening.

Review.Titre: Got what was offered for my phone
Review.Contenu: Got what was offered for my phone.  The process took a little longer that previous times that I have done it

Review.Titre: Takes a while to receive confirmation and approval...
Review.Contenu: Took quite a while to receive confirmation and approval of the purchase.
Received a fair evaluation and payment for my old iPad.
It was great. The only thing that stopped 5 stars was giving me less for it than promised.

Review.Titre: I think you cut the prices back more…
Review.Contenu: I think you cut the prices back more than necessary

Relatively happy with my experience. Gadget Gone was expedient with evaluation and payment. They have final say of what they pay so everything is based on their opinion. If you are trading in selling something don’t expect anything more than good as their criteria for flawless is brand new items only. Other than that I recommend them good avenue to move older gadgets taking up shelf space at home.

Excellent customer service and communication. Just be careful if you take your payment through PayPal, you do not get the quoted price because Paypal will take out fees and taxes. Paypal also held my payment until I could prove I had shipped the phone, but thats a Paypal issue. I would just recommend that Gadget Gone give the true amount you'll receive if you take your payment through Paypal when they give you the quote. Otherwise an excellent service!!

Read about this company on cnet. Easily received an offer and sent in my device. Communication was great at first but I became concerned when after several days I checked the status of my device and it came back “not found”. I contacted the company and received a response a day later; I then received my confirmation and payment not long after that. Worked out fine with a hiccup in the middle of the process.

The experience has been mixed. I sent in my iPhone and 4 weeks later received my check..the positive side of this is that the company was  always in communication with the reason for the delay and kept me updated. Was a little disappointing that it took so long but apparently there was a staffing issue. Bottom line it was a pleasant experience.wou;d definitely use them again.

The company communicated wonderfully with me - I was grateful for that!  All of my phones brought a lower price than I was originally quoted, but part of that was my misunderstanding, and I did have an opportunity for them to send my phones back, which I did not do.  I would definitely recommend this company.

Review.Titre: Your partnership with PayPal ruined my experience
Review.Contenu: You guys have been great! Responsive, fair, and great communication as it relates to the deal and condition of the phone. I just hate that you have a partnership with PayPal. I wish I had just requested a check.  The sad part is I have a business account, regular account, and PayPal credit card and they are still making me jump through hoops to get my money.  I am really disappointed in them.

The actual process of selling my iPhone went smoothly. I liked the level of communication and responsiveness—they reply to emails usually by the end of the day. I recommend taking lots of pics of your item before sending. After I sent the iPhone to them, they emailed me saying they were lowering the offer price because of scratches on the glass. I asked them to send me a pic of the scratches, then I sent them a pic that I had taken and they raised the offer price a little ($5) but not back up to the original offer price. They did offer to send the iPhone back to me if I didn’t accept the offer price.

Super fast communication and check delivery. One teeney tiny scratch you could hardly see (that I didn’t even notice) brought down my estimate from “flawless.” Even brand new out of the box would conceivably have that. They even sent picture when I asked for details. But, amount I got was still higher than any other company. I would use this company again.

I’ve used GadgetGone 3/4 times now. Each time I have had a good experience. I don’t have really any complaints. Their prices are top-notch, and the whole process is pretty easy. I do wish it were a bit quicker, but I’m sure they have many people sending in devices so that’s not entirely their fault. Overall, I’d recommend them to anyone looking to sell their devices.

Highly recommend Gadget Gone.  They kept in touch regularly as they inspected the phone and offered a price after inspection.  The check came within a week of their offer.I gave them a 4 only because I wish they gave price ranges on their website of what they will pay.  Although my phone was in perfect shape cosmetically, the insides were not working properly. Due to this I was offered a much lower price than originally thought.I would still use them again!

Review.Titre: Great Service, Negotiable Payouts (in some cases)
Review.Contenu: Shipping was a bit slow however that is mainly issues with USPS. The ease of use on the site and the wide range of devices to be sold was incredibly helpful! Their rating policy is very unique and fair. Their automatic system is a bit rough and harsh with its assessment, but in my case they were happy to work something out for me. Slow communication but they did always get back to me. Overall it is a great service and I will be definitely using them in the future!

My only neutral response is the inspection process, which is delayed to 5-7 business days due to volume of incoming product. Otherwise, the website was excellent and the process very easy. Communication from GadgetGone was EXCELLENT! There certainly wasn't any delay with communication. They were always friendly and prompt to any inquiry. A manager even offered to pull my order and expedite the inspection, which was appreciated. I would use GadgetGone again. Thanks!

Review.Titre: Easy process, but battery could be an issue.
Review.Contenu: The process was quite simple and easy. However, my initial quote was revised after my battery was below a certain threshold and I was given a substantially lower offer for my phone. I rejected that and asked for my phone back, but they decided to finally agree to give me my original offer. So while I’m happy I was given a fair deal for my phone, I was worried that it might be a bait and switch. Overall pleased.

I originally posted a review saying how disappointed I was that what I thought was my flawless phone was not graded as flawless by Gadget Zone.  There was a very tiny chip that I did not even see until I expanded my pre-shipping photo, but Gadget Zone saw it.  The owner Patrick was gracious and understanding and resolved my issue very quickly.   If you are thinking of purchasing or selling you can trust that Gadget Zone is a reputable company.
